original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 318/323 against spot dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee was quoted at 318/323 to the US dollar in mid-morning trade Monday in the spot market after opening at 315/322, dealers said as data showed de-leveraging supporting the appreciation of the peg.
The rupee had been stabilizing around 320 to the US dollar amid central bank purchases in the last few trading days.
Spot sales volumes have eased after the initial rush of around 100 million US dollars a day.
On Friday there was 7.5 million dollars of spot trades, 11.5 million ton, 9.55 cash and 14 million forward.
The central bank said it bought 500 million US dollars after a surrender rule was lifted.
However the agency had made conditions right for stabilizing the rupee by hiking rates and halting money printing.
Sri Lanka’s interest rates are high partly due to fears of domestic debt re-structuring.
In January private credit contracted 96 billion rupees, up from 86 billion rupees a month earlier.
